GFAP Diary GFAP Protein Diary Attention Back Delete Cancel Are you sure you want to delete? No GFAP values stored.\nTap + to add. No measurements yet Last measurement" Edit Item Item Details Add Item Item Name* Gfap Value* No GFAP value Save Edit Yes *required fields GFAP (Glial Fibrillary Acidic Protein) is a structural protein found primarily in astrocytes, a type of glial cell in the central nervous system.\nElevated GFAP levels are associated with traumatic brain injury, stroke, and diseases like Alzheimer\'s, making it a key biomaker for neurological conditions.\nThis application is intended for users who need to continuously monitor their GFAP levels, view statistical data, and share their history with medical professionals. Normal levels: 0 - 0.2 ng/ml Elevated levels: 0.2 - 0.5 ng/ml High levels: >0.5 ng/ml 30-Day Average" ng/ml Settings" Normal Levels Elevated Levels High Levels Comment (optional)"
